sentence.Network_en: While the inclination to procrastinate is common, one must fully consider the detrimental impact of unnecessary delays.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然拖延的倾向是普遍的, 但是人们应该充分考虑到不必要的延误造成的有害影响.

sentence.Network_en: Most often we procrastinate when faced with something we do not want to do.
sentence.Network_cn: 面对不想做的事情，我们经常拖延。

sentence.Network_en: To procrastinate, I fell in with the spirit of the occasion.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了拖延时间, 我也就顺应看当时的气氛.

list.abs: stop procrastinating - finish something ., 停止拖延 , 完成任务.

We are all familiar with the procrastination phenomenon ., 对拖延现象我们是再熟悉不过了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin procrastinat- 'deferred till the morning', from the verb procrastinare, from pro- 'forward' + crastinus 'belonging to tomorrow' (from cras 'tomorrow')

entry.def: If you procrastinate, you keep leaving things you should do until later, often because you do not want to do them.

example.ex: Most often we procrastinate when faced with something we do not want to do.
example.tran: 面对不想做的事情，我们经常拖延。

means.word_mean: 1. postpone doing what one should be doing;

sentences.sentence: "He did not want to write the letter and procrastinated for days"
"He procrastinated the matter until it was almost too late"

auth_sentence.content: Hence I tend to procrastinate and get bored VERY easily.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hence I tend to procrastinate and get bored VERY easily.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hence I tend to procrastinate and get bored VERY easily.

auth_sentence.content: Those people, evidence suggests, are more likely to procrastinate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those people, evidence suggests, are more likely to procrastinate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those people, evidence suggests, are more likely to procrastinate.

auth_sentence.content: There's something comforting about this story: even Nobel-winning economists procrastinate!
auth_sentence.res_content: There's something comforting about this story: even Nobel-winning economists procrastinate!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There's something comforting about this story: even Nobel-winning economists procrastinate!

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"赞同,亲…"; 2. 也有"代替"之意; 3. 表示"向前,在前;预先"; 4. 表示"很多…"

pro向前,在前;预先+fil线条+e→前面的线条

pro向前,在前;预先+fess说→在前面说坦白

Sentence.sentence: Back in the good old days—say, two years ago, when the last of my children suffered the ordeal (折磨)—a high-school student applying to college could procrastinate all the way to New Year's Day of their senior year, assuming they could withstand the parental pestering (烦扰).

sentences.en: He procrastinate until it is too late to do anything at all.
While the inclination to procrastinate is common , one must fully consider the detrimental impact of unnecessary delays.
sentences.cn: 虽然拖延的倾向是普遍的，但是人们应该充分考虑到不必要的延误造成的有害影响。
